title: Rehoboam's Downfall
shortSummary: This chapter recounts King Rehoboam's failure to remain faithful to God after establishing his reign, leading to an invasion by Shishak, king of Egypt. Despite God's judgment, Rehoboam humbles himself, and God grants partial deliverance, illustrating the consequences of forsaking the Lord and the power of repentance.
timeline: c. 930 BC - Early reign of King Rehoboam following Solomon's death

keyCharacters.name: Rehoboam
keyCharacters.description: King of Judah who forsook the law of the LORD, leading to Egypt's invasion, but later humbled himself before God.

keyCharacters.name: Shishak
keyCharacters.description: King of Egypt who attacked Jerusalem as judgment for Israel's disobedience.

keyCharacters.name: Shemaiah
keyCharacters.description: Prophet who delivered God's message to Rehoboam and the princes, calling them to humility and repentance.

keyCharacters.name: Naamah
keyCharacters.description: Ammonitess and mother of Rehoboam, noted as part of his genealogy.

outline.heading: Rehoboam Forsakes God and Faces Judgment
outline.description: After establishing his kingdom, Rehoboam and Israel abandon God's law, prompting Shishak, king of Egypt, to invade Judah with a vast army and capture fortified cities.

outline.heading: Prophetic Warning and Humbling
outline.description: Prophet Shemaiah confronts Rehoboam and the princes, declaring God's judgment due to their unfaithfulness; upon their humility, God relents from complete destruction but allows servitude.

outline.heading: Loss of Treasures and Rehoboam’s Response
outline.description: Shishak plunders the treasures of the temple and the king’s house, including Solomon’s gold shields, which Rehoboam replaces with brass, symbolizing diminished glory.

outline.heading: God’s Mercy and Rehoboam’s Later Reign
outline.description: Rehoboam’s humility turns away God’s wrath, leading to a period of relative peace; however, he continues in evil by not seeking the LORD fully, and his reign ends with his death and succession by Abijah.

application: Remain steadfast in obedience to God’s law to avoid the consequences of forsaking Him.
When confronted with sin or judgment, respond with genuine humility and repentance to receive God’s mercy.
Recognize that God’s discipline may serve to teach dependence and faithfulness, even through hardship.
Seek the LORD wholeheartedly to strengthen your walk and leadership, avoiding the pitfalls of half-hearted devotion.

keyVerses.text: And it came to pass, when Rehoboam had established the kingdom, and had strengthened himself, he forsook the law of the LORD, and all Israel with him.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the root cause of Judah’s downfall—Rehoboam’s and Israel’s abandonment of God’s law.

keyVerses.text: And when the LORD saw that they humbled themselves, the word of the LORD came to Shemaiah, saying, They have humbled themselves; therefore I will not destroy them, but I will grant them some deliverance; and my wrath shall not be poured out upon Jerusalem by the hand of Shishak.
keyVerses.significance: This verse demonstrates God’s mercy in response to humility and repentance, even amid judgment.

keyVerses.text: And he did evil, because he prepared not his heart to seek the LORD.
keyVerses.significance: This verse serves as a warning about the importance of continually seeking God’s guidance and not hardening one’s heart.
